reviews.review_msg: I believe this was her first time teaching, and she did a phenomenal job. Clear & thorough. Compiled her own hand-made pre-class and post-class summaries into an AMAZING and incredibly comprehensive final review booklet before the final. Hard course, but she makes it as easy as possible. Couldn't recommend her more.

Nice guy, should not be a TA. Participation is a huge part of your mark in the class, yet he doesn't allow for much chances to talk. He spends 85% of the time talking, and when he does allow student to talk he will cut them off if not interested in what they have to say. He talks about issues not related to the readings and doesn't clarify anything

A very tough grader, and often didn't mark according to the criteria given.  Is often difficult to understand the way he speaks, due to his accent as well as his low volume of speaking.  I wouldn't recommend.

This guy should not be a professor. Whatever you do, do NOT take a course with him. Took a summer course with him. We did not get the results from assignments/group discussions until two days before our final. Absolutely ridiculous.

taking us politics 223, so far, the course is very very disorganized. weekly group discussions were a complete disaster. nobody knew who was moderating for what date. no real guidelines are given for assignments, and is increasingly unavailable in terms of answering emails. so far, not enjoying this course despite my interest in this area.

Very nice guy but somewhat disorganized on sending lecture notes. Course syllabus was not very useful or have relevant info on the weekly sessions. No info given on the term paper guideline or marking scheme. He just told us to pick a topic and analyze it. Not a fair marker either. Exams were short answer and essay type questions. Not enjoyable.
